claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

extracted_evidence.quote: Standard Dose Flu zone and FlucelVax. HD-IIV4 was High Dose Flu zone, RIV4 was Flublok and Adj-IV was FluAd.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly identifies RIV4 as Flublok, establishing which product is being discussed in the context of vaccine comparisons.

extracted_evidence.quote: Two large studies have explored rVE of recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4). The Medicare beneficiaries study [10] using retrospective data as described above, reported significant rVE of RIV4 vs. SD-IIV4) against influenza related hospital encounters. Secondly, a randomized controlled trial (RCT) found significant rVE of RIV4 compared with SD-IIV4 among adults 50 years old, but not for adults 65 years old [11].
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides direct evidence that RIV4 (Flublok) has greater effectiveness (relative vaccine effectiveness, rVE) compared to standard-dose influenza vaccines (SD-IIV4), supporting the claim that higher antigen content is linked to greater immunogenicity.

extracted_evidence.quote: Conclusions: Overall adults, both RIV4 and SD-IIV4 were effective against influenza hospitalization, RIV4 providing better protection compared with SD-IIV4 overall, for females, younger adults, and those with no high risk conditions.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This statement from the conclusions section directly affirms that RIV4 (Flublok) provided better protection than standard-dose vaccines, supporting the link between its higher antigen content and greater immunogenicity.

extracted_evidence.quote: RIV4: Flublok. c SD-IIV4: Afluria, Fluarix, FluLaval, Standard Dose Flu zone and FlucelVax.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote clarifies the vaccine brands included in each group, confirming that Flublok is the RIV4 (recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine) being compared to standard-dose vaccines.
